intro: Hieracium mutilescens, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of yellow disk flowers surrounded by white to pale yellow ray florets. It is an annual or biennial plant that spreads through seeds and has a moderate growth rate.
